bibl.title: Visibility and Violence in Petitions from Roman Egypt
bibl.note: Paper presented at the Ancient Societies Workshop at the University of Chicago and at the XXVth International Congress of Papyrology in Ann Arbor. - "The act of making a legal complaint was a ritual of redemption through which individuals could save face in the community in which they lived."
BRYEN Ari Z., Visibility and Violence in Petitions from Roman Egypt.
